venue.name: Welch Dickey Loop Trail Parking Lot

item.description:
After throwing things around a bit, we have decided on the shorter/less strenuous Welch/Dickey, the 4.5 mile loop hike filled with rock ledges and views, with granite slabs and views, and more rock ledges and views, annnd... more granite slabs and views; you get the picture. A hike that is known for its vast number of open ledges and panoramic overlooks, a hike that has been said to rival the Franconia Ridge in regards to views, stream crossings and mixed forest... annnd, for a lot less trouble.

Thou there are some scrambles and a steep section or two, it will be by far the easiest hike of the weekend, a hike that even the most harrowed body and soul should be able to complete without too much penance. It is also a hike that, no matter how doggedly we slog, should only take us round-a-about 3 - 3 1/2 hours to complete.

Total elevation gain: an easy peasy 1500'

About the Hike

From the Welch/Dickey trailhead, we will follow the Mt. Welch path off to the right (hiking the loop in a counter clock-wise direction). The path will first cross and follow a small brook upstream, and then turning back on itself, angle its way up to our first open ledge at about 1.3 miles. From here we'll be able to take in the beautiful Sandwich Dome, before continuing our rise to Mt Welch. On our way up, we'll encounter stands of the rare Jack Pine and a not so rare scramble or two before summiting at 2,605 feet. On top, we'll reap our reward: the 360 degree panorama of Sandwich Mt., Mt. Tripyramid, Mt. Dickey and Mt. Tecumseh... along with Mooselauke and Carr Mountain.

As we head over to Dickey, the trail drops steeply into a small col before rising to Dickey's summit (2,734'). Here, we'll find a side path leading to a "most" fine overlook of Tecumseh and the Franconia Ridge. After taking in the last of our summit views, we'll head home, down a path of moderate grade, past more open ledges, before reentering the woods, where we will eventually be lead back to our cars in near about 1.5 miles.

EQUIPMENT CHECKLIST

Warm Weather/Spring Essentials (1/2 Day Hike):
• Synthetic Quick-drying Wicking Pants/Shorts
• Synthetic Quick-drying Wicking Shirt
• Softshell/Fleece Jacket
• Waterproof/Windproof Shell
• Synthetic or Wool Sock Liners (wicking layer)
• Synthetic or Wool Socks
• Sturdy Hiking Boots/Shoes (waterproof) 
• Extra pair of Socks 
• Lunch 
• Snack/Energy Food (extra food) 
• Water (min. 2L) 
• Map/Compass/Whistle 
• Headlamp/Flashlight (w/ fresh lithium batteries) 

the Remaining Essentials:
• Medication/First Aid Supplies 
• Fire (waterproof matches, lighter, starter)
• Repair Kit/Knife

Optional:
• Sunscreen/Sunglasses/Bug Repellent/Toiletries 
• Trekking Poles 
• Camera/Binoculars


 

Directions

From I-93, take Exit 28 and head east toward Waterville Valley on NH 49. In 5.6 miles turn left onto Upper Mad River Road. In 0.6 mile turn right onto Orris Road, following signs for the Welch-Dickey Loop Trail. In another 0.6 mile turn right onto gravel road, which leads 50 yards to the parking area for the Welch-Dickey Loop Trail.

THERE IS A $3 PARKING FEE, should you not have a WMNF Parking Pass.

Welch Dickey Loop Trail Parking: http://maps.google.com/maps...
Coordinates: 43.904044, -71.591208


Liability Waiver

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: From I-93 exit 28, follow 49E & turn left onto Upper Mad River Rd., follow Mad River to Orris Rd., turn right & follow Orris for approx. 1/2 mile, turn right onto short gravel side road, parking is near about 50ft. off Orris; Cell: 860-460-1500
item.name: Sunday Hike (Welch/Dickey)
